titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Jeannette Gorman Papers
titlestmt.author: Isabel Carleton

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid created with EADitor by Isabel Carleton

did.abstract: The collection contains only one series: business correspondences. These correspondences (mostly letters, but also budgets, invitations, meeting minutes, some photos, etc.) concern the goings-on of committees that Jeanette Gorman was a part of.

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open to researchers by appointment only.

bioghist.p: Jeanette Gorman was a Cary Institute employee whose work involved education, development, fundraising, and membership on the Music Committee.

scopecontent.p: Includes announcements, guidelines, and the reception of a Nine Partners Garden Club Antique Fair located at the Gifford House. Letters regarding a chamber music series at the arboretum. Reports regarding who received 1981-1982 grant funding, and what they planned to do with it. Documents planning Music Committee events, like parties and performances. Discussions about organizing events with other local arts councils. Planning and reception of a gifted education ecology program about native American ethnobotany. Correspondences with local garden clubs regarding Cary arboretum membership and tours. McCann Foundation grant requests. Music committee party planning.

userestrict.p: The materials in this collection are protected by copyright.

scopecontent.p: " Notices and announcements, letters, rules, coupons " About antique fair, before and after
" Letters " About chamber music series in the arboretum
" Reports, often in list form " About scientists, what they got grants for, and what they want to research, lists of who is funding projects

" Invitations, Letters, photos, Lists, expense accounts, Meeting Notes, menus, purchase orders, envelopes, budgets, reports, records, notes, reviews, programs, grant applications " About Music committee affairs (party, board membership, events, concerts). Includes a lot of information about how events were budgeted and who performed at them. Also lots of meeting notes.
" About various art councils. Organizing musical events and applying for money. Mostly about a specific Dixieland/jazz/band concert

" Grants, budget sheets, applications, descriptions, printed photos, budget proposal, organizational charts, CV's, job applications " About educational outreach, more specifically a gifted education ecology program about native American ethnobotany.

" Grant History, Letters, Proposals, budgets " McCann Foundation gives grants to groups like Cary. Most a record of grant requests about education and accessibility. Info about seminars and programs at Marist and in Poughkeepsie. Descriptions of a speaker and of the Cary Arboretum
" Letters, invitations, lists, budgets " About planning a spring party, including horticultural plans
